parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From ana and ago; to lead up; by extension to bring out; specially, to sail away.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
Paphos, a city at the western end of Cyprus. Of uncertain derivation; Paphus, a place in Cyprus.
Paul, Paulus. Of Latin origin; Paulus, the name of a Roman and of an apostle.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural

str2: A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Probably from the same as Pergamos; a tower; Perga, a place in Asia Minor.
From a compound of pas and pura; every-tribal, i.e. Heterogeneous; Pamphylia, a region of Asia Minor.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.
Of Hebrew origin; Joannes, the name of four Israelites.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To go away, depart, withdraw. From apo and choreo; to go away.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To turn back, return. From hupo and strepho; to turn under, i.e. To return.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
The Greek form of the Hebrew name: Jerusalem. Of Hebrew origin; Hierosolyma
